text:
Ghana, Mauritius agree to waive visa for each other’s national passport holders Published on : Thursday, August 27, 2015
Following the signing of an agreement on mutual visa waiver exemption in Port Louis on Monday, the deal has been finalised between Ghana and Mauritius agreeing to waive visa requirements for holders of each other’s national passports.
Ghana’s President John Mahama’s was on a three-day State visit to the island nation.
President Mahama said his visit to Mauritius “begins a process that will crown our years of collaboration and discussions at the highest level towards strengthening bilateral, trade and political co-operation between our two countries”.
He welcomed the decision of the Mauritius government to invest in an ICT Enclave in Tema, near Accra, through the Mauritius Board for Investment, in partnership with the Government of Ghana.
The project will create in excess of 5,000 direct jobs for young graduates, provide many more thousands of indirect job opportunities, and serve as an ICT hub in the West African sub- region.
The two leaders discussed a number of issues, including collaboration on international issues and developments, including climate change, the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and terrorism.
